meanings.definition: The quality of not being sincere or genuine.
meanings.sent1: Her insincerities were evident in her fake smile.
meanings.sent2: He could see through the insincerities of the salesman.
meanings.sent3: The insincerities of the politician were exposed during the debate.
meanings.sent4: The insincerities of the friendship became clear over time.
meanings.sent5: The insincerities in his apology left her feeling betrayed.

meanings.definition: Instances of not being sincere or genuine.
meanings.sent1: The letter was full of insincerities and false promises.
meanings.sent2: She was tired of dealing with insincerities in the workplace.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit hilariously portrayed the insincerities of social media influencers.
meanings.sent4: The movie highlighted the insincerities of the characters' relationships.
meanings.sent5: The insincerities in his words made her question his intentions.
